summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Yakima Avenue, in the City of Seattle, from one hundred (100) feet south of Dearborn Street to sixty (60) feet north of Atlantic Street, and Day Street, from Yakima Avenue to Twenty-ninth Avenue South, by constructing therein a sewer of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, openings, manholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 466 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
